column4: Hey guys, when I turn on my computer, Grub loads fine, and then it goes to the next page, and it has some text, and then it says "Ok, Booting the kernel..." After that, it just sits at a black screen, but it used to display the start up processes, with that progress bar. I can still boot, but I would like to have that progress bar. Any ideas?
what's up, bigbadgoat?
aMSN has voice and video
ok
you will be prompted for your PW
ok
what happens?

Hey guys, when I turn on my computer, Grub loads fine, and then it goes to the next page, and it has some text, and then it says "Ok, Booting the kernel..." After that, it just sits at a black screen, but it used to display the start up processes, with that progress bar. I can still boot, but I would like to have that progress bar. Any ideas?
check your menu.lst file for inclusion of 'splash' and 'quiet'
i see it a few times
my first option on the list looks like this: kernel  /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.15-25-386 root=/dev/hda2 ro quiet splash
i see this: kernel  /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.15-25-386 root=/dev/hda2 ro quiet splash
i edited the menu.lst, and now i see stuff on the screen, butit is just text, not the progress bar
could you paste your menu.lst to the pastesiter?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/16043
did you see the link?
err.. wheres the splash and quiet options ?
how should my menu.lst look?
here is my current menu.lst http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/16046
looks good. still no progress bar?
update-alternatives --config usplash-artwork.so
try doing that too
i get this error There is only 1 program which provides usplash-artwork.so
